meanings.definition: To come upon after losing something and searching for it.
examples: Stem cells are found in different parts of the human body, including in our blood.

images.alt: Photo of a father and daughter reading a book.
images.description: A father and daughter reading a book.
images.caption: This child is finding hidden objects in this popup book.

source.title: Dad and Daughter Reading a Cutouts Fairy Tale Book
source.author: cottonbro

meanings.definition: To find the position or place of.
examples: Stem cells are located in different parts of the human body, including in our blood.

images.alt: Photo of a father and daughter reading a book.
images.description: A father and daughter reading a book.
images.caption: This child is finding hidden objects in this popup book.

source.title: Dad and Daughter Reading a Cutouts Fairy Tale Book
source.author: cottonbro

meanings.definition: Something that takes the position of another or takes over the function of another.
examples: With more research, we may be able to grow replacement parts for humans from stem cells.

images.alt: Rows of candies, with one green diamond in the place of a red heart.
images.description: A large number are shown, gathered around a stage.
images.caption: A green diamond-shaped candy replaces one of the red heart candies.

source.title: Heart shaped gummy candy assorted in rows with one candy aside against pink background
source.author: Karolina Grabowska

meanings.definition: Having recently arrived, been produced, or come into being.
examples: With more research, we may be able to grow new parts for humans from stem cells.

meanings.definition: An animal or plant that is just starting to develop. An embryo grows inside an egg, a seed, or its mother.
examples: A seed holds a plant embryo.

images.description: A light colored object, against a bright background. Light shines through the object, making some bones and blood vessels visible.
images.caption: Photo of a human embryo at 7 weeks of development.

meanings.definition: To make unable to move or to feel any sensation.
examples: A paralyzing disease made him unable to walk.

meanings.definition: A reasonable, widely accepted explanation for why something happens.
examples: After studying plants and animals in South America, Charles Darwin worked out the theory of evolution by natural selection.

meanings.definition: To look into carefully and closely so as to learn the facts; examine.
examples: The police are investigating the crime.

images.alt: Photo of child using a magnifying glass to look at an object in her hand
images.description: In one hand, a child holds a round, hand-held glass that magnifies the appearance of objects. She is looking through the glass at something she holds in her other hand.
images.caption: A magnifying glass helps this girl investigate the details of an object.

source.title: Cute Asian girl investigating leaves of potted plants
source.author: Gabby K

examples: To obtain a driver's license, you have to pass a test.

images.alt: Photo of a person's arm reaching out and taking a book from a shelf.
images.description: A person reaches out to take a book from a bookshelf.
images.caption: Go to the library to obtain a book on almost any subject.
